page.title: 07Transport,Freight,St.Austell
page.content: As St.Austell is the home of the China clay industry, the main freight trains carry china clay. Some go to the port of Fowey where the clay is shipped all over the world. One train a day goes to the Potteries and another takes clay slurry to Sittingbourne. Wagons loaded with clay also go to paper makers in Scotland. The station opens from 3.3Oa.m. until 11p.m. The earliest trains are the overnight parcels and the Royal Mail and newspaper trains, which leave London late at night or in the early hours of the morning. The last train at night is the sleeper to London which leaves at 1O.5O p.m.
